m_szDocTitle: The deals that could cut your household bills by £2,000 | The Sunday Times
m_szDocSumamry: The deals that could cut your household bills by £2,000 Your renewal quote or current tariff may seem good value, but rival firms often do better Melanie Wright Published: 4 May 2014 Print Linzi Emberton, 25, from Wrexham, saved £700 by switching energy and car insurance providers. She is pictured with sons Alex, 4, and Stephen, 2 (Richard Stanton) FAMILIES looking to free up cash for their summer holidays could save more  than £2,000 just by reviewing their finances and switching to better deals. Analysis for The Sunday Times by the comparison site comparethemarket.com and  the research firm
